title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1263.5 - Porter service charges
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1263.5 - Porter service charges

State Regulations
(a) For each
passenger embarking upon and for each passenger disembarking from an aircraft
at the International Arrival and Airline Wing buildings (whether or not such
passenger actually uses porter service).............50

Such charge shall not be payable in connection with
aircraft using the ramps adjacent to the International Arrival and Airline Wing
buildings only for the purpose of picking up or delivering passengers embarking
upon or disembarking from flights of the airlines using such buildings. (b) Such charge shall not be
payable in connection with passengers on sightseeing flights (by which is meant
flights on which passengers are carried for hire and which originate and
terminate at the air terminal with no intermediate stops other than emergency
stops), and which flights are conducted under permit from the Port Authority; and such passengers shall not be included in the computation of the average
cost per passenger of porter service hereunder. (c) Such charge shall not be payable in
connection with passengers who disembark from an aircraft which has returned to
the airport subsequent to take-off and prior to its first scheduled stop
because of mechanical or other difficulties and who subsequently embark upon
the same or a substituted aircraft without requiring porter service. (d) Such charge shall not be payable in
connection with aircraft using the ramps adjacent to such buildings merely to
pick up or deliver passengers embarking upon or disembarking from flights of
the airlines using such buildings. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1263.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
